points.title: System Time
points.help: Attribute in Basic cluster

points.title: Operating Mode
points.help: Attribute in Basic cluster

points.title: Ignore Grid-Loss Warning
points.help: When enabled, the inverter will not treat the absence of grid power as a fault. Use this mode for permanently off-grid systems where grid connection is intentionally unavailable.

points.title: Power Status
points.help: Attribute in Basic cluster

points.title: Reset to Factory Defaults
points.help: Restores all inverter configuration parameters to their original factory values. Use with caution — this cannot be undone.

points.title: Inverter Power Control
points.help:
Turns the inverter output on or off.

• **Standby:** AC output is disabled, but control circuits remain powered.
• **Power On:** Enables AC output and normal inverter operation.

points.title: Active Power Limiting Status
points.help: Indicates whether inverter output power limiting is currently active. If active, the inverter will limit its output power to the 'Current Power Limit'.

points.title: Current Power Limit
points.help: The inverter's present active-power output limit as a percentage of its rated capacity. If power limiting is active, the inverter will limit its output power to this percentage of its rated capacity.

points.title: Feed to Grid
points.help: Allows the inverter to export power back to the utility grid. Enable this only if local regulations and interconnect agreements permit grid export.

points.title: Export Power Limit
points.help: Sets the maximum power the inverter is allowed to send to the grid. Use this to meet utility export limits or site commissioning requirements.

points.title: Fast Zero Export
points.help: Forces export power to the grid to stay at or near zero by rapidly adjusting inverter output. Use when export is not allowed or must be minimized.

points.title: Allow Charging from Grid
points.help: Enables charging the battery from the utility grid.

points.title: Grid Charge Power Limit
points.help: Sets the maximum power the inverter will draw from the grid for charging. This cap applies when Grid Charge is enabled (and within any configured time windows).

points.title: Grid Charge SOC Limits
points.help: Defines when grid charging starts and stops based on battery state of charge (SOC). Charging starts when SOC falls below Start, and stops when SOC reaches Stop.

entries.name: Start SOC (%)
entries.description: Begin grid charging when battery SOC drops to this level (typical 20–40%)

entries.name: Stop SOC (%)
entries.description: Stop grid charging when battery SOC reaches this level (typical 80–95%)

points.title: Grid Charge Control Type
points.help: Select whether grid charging follows a time schedule or SOC/voltage thresholds.

points.title: Grid Charge Windows (Placeholder.  I'll break this up later.)
points.help: During these times, your battery will continue to charge from solar power normally, but will also use additional power from the grid to charge the battery.

points.title: Modbus Address
points.help: Sets the Modbus address (slave ID) for this inverter on the parallel bus.

points.title: System Type
points.help:
Defines how this inverter participates in a multi-inverter or multi-phase system.

• No Parallel: Single inverter system.
• Single-phase Parallel (Master / Secondary): Multiple inverters on one phase.
• Three-phase Parallel (Master): Multiple inverters forming R/S/T phases.

points.title: Assigned Phase
points.help: Selects which output phase this inverter is responsible for in a three-phase system. R, S, and T correspond to L1, L2, and L3.

points.title: Share Battery
points.help: Allows inverters in a parallel group to use a common battery bank instead of keeping batteries isolated per inverter.

friendly_meanings.1: Inverters Share a Common Battery Bank

points.title: Parallel Group Size
points.help: Total number of inverters detected in this parallel system.

points.title: Inverter Role
points.help: Reports whether this inverter is acting as Master or Secondary in the current parallel configuration.

points.title: Reported Phase
points.help: Reports which phase (R / S / T) this inverter is currently serving in the parallel system.

points.title: CT Ratio
points.help: Select the current transformer (CT) ratio used for metering. This must match the CT hardware rating so that current and power readings are accurate.

points.title: CT Direction
points.help: Sets the CT installation direction. Use Reversed if the CT arrow is facing the opposite way and the system is reading import/export backwards.

points.title: Battery Type
points.help: Specifies the chemistry or general type of connected battery. Choose **No Battery** for standalone PV or grid-tie operation, **Lead-acid** for flooded or AGM batteries, or **Lithium-ion** for managed BMS packs.

points.title: Battery Brand
points.help: Selects the manufacturer profile for the connected battery. This may pre-configure recommended voltage and SOC limits for optimal operation.

points.title: Absorb Voltage
points.help: Sets the voltage used during the absorb (bulk-to-float transition) phase. Increasing this value raises the upper charge threshold for lead-acid batteries.

points.title: Float Voltage
points.help: Defines the voltage maintained once the battery is fully charged. This helps prevent overcharging while keeping the battery topped off.

points.title: Start Derating Voltage
points.help: Voltage threshold where the inverter begins reducing charge or discharge current to protect the battery as it approaches full or low state.

points.title: Battery Control Type
points.help:
Determines how the inverter regulates both charging and discharging.

SOC: Uses battery state of charge thresholds to start and stop charge/discharge.

Volt: Uses DC voltage limits instead.

points.title: Charge Limit (SOC)
points.help: Sets the maximum state of charge (SOC) the battery will be charged to. Once the battery reaches this level, charging stops to prevent overcharging and extend lifespan.

points.title: Max Battery Current
points.help: Sets the maximum charging and discharging current allowed for the connected inverter. Choose the preset that matches your inverter model to automatically apply the correct limits.

points.title: On-Grid Battery Cutoff SOC
points.help: Sets the minimum state of charge (SOC) the battery will discharge to while grid power is available. Below this level, the inverter will stop discharging and switch to grid power to protect battery capacity.

points.title: Off-Grid Battery Cutoff SOC
points.help: Sets the minimum state of charge (SOC) the battery will discharge to when operating off-grid. Once the battery reaches this level, the inverter stops discharging to prevent deep discharge and maintain battery health.

points.title: Battery Backup Mode
points.help: Enables or disables battery-backup operation. When enabled, the inverter reserves part of the battery capacity to power critical loads during a grid outage.

points.title: Battery Reserve SOC
points.help: While Battery Backup Mode is enabled, the battery will stop discharging once it reaches this level. When Backup Mode is disabled, normal operation applies and discharge will continue down to the On-Grid or Off-Grid Battery Cutoff SOC.

points.title: Battery Scheduling
points.help: Enables the battery scheduling feature. This must be turned on for Time-of-Use (TOU) charge and discharge schedules to take effect. When disabled, all TOU settings are ignored and normal battery behavior applies.

points.title: Max Power During Scheduled Charge
points.help: Sets the maximum charging power during scheduled Time-of-Use (TOU) charge periods. Limit this to control how hard the battery charges from the grid in those windows.

points.title: TOU Charge Window 1
points.help: Defines the first time window when the battery is allowed to charge according to TOU rules. The inverter may charge from grid during this window, subject to the TOU Max Charge Power limit.

points.title: TOU Charge Window 2
points.help: Defines the second allowed charging window for TOU operation.

points.title: TOU Charge Window 3
points.help: Defines the third allowed charging window for TOU operation.

points.title: TOU Max Discharge Power
points.help: Sets the maximum discharging power during scheduled Time-of-Use (TOU) discharge periods. Limit this to control how much battery power is exported to loads or grid during those windows.

points.title: TOU Discharge Stop SOC
points.help: Sets the minimum state of charge (SOC) that the battery will discharge to during TOU operation. Once this level is reached, discharging stops to preserve reserve capacity for later use or backup.

points.title: TOU Discharge Window 1
points.help: Defines the first time window when the battery is allowed to discharge during TOU operation. The inverter can supply loads or export power during this window, within the Max Discharge Power limit.

points.title: TOU Discharge Window 2
points.help: Defines the second allowed discharge window for TOU operation.

points.title: TOU Discharge Window 3
points.help: Defines the third allowed discharge window for TOU operation.

points.title: Grid Parameters
points.help: This setting changes the conditions under which the inverter will trip off. Different areas have different rules about when this equipment is allowed to disconnect and when it must ride through. Choose the code required by the local utility or AHJ.

points.title: Grid Type
points.help: Choose the type of wriing the sites uses.  This helps configure the system to match the build's power setup.  Note the voltage you enter here must match the EPS Voltage.

points.title: Grid Frequency
points.help: Sets the nominal grid frequency for the installation. Use 60 Hz for North America and most split-phase installs; use 50 Hz for regions that operate at 230 V single-phase.

points.title: Grid Voltage Limits (Stage 1)
points.help: Voltage trip window. If grid voltage rises above or falls below these thresholds for longer than the threshold time allows, the inverter will disconnect.

points.title: Grid Voltage Limits (Stage 2)
points.help: Voltage trip window. If grid voltage rises above or falls below these thresholds for longer than the threshold time allows, the inverter will disconnect.

points.title: Grid Voltage Limits (Stage 3)
points.help: Voltage trip window. If grid voltage rises above or falls below these thresholds for longer than the threshold time allows, the inverter will disconnect.

points.title: Grid Frequency Limits (Stage 1)
points.help: Sets the upper and lower grid frequency thresholds. If grid frequency goes outside this range, the inverter will disconnect to protect the system and comply with grid safety standards.

points.title: Grid Frequency Limits (Stage 2)
points.help: Sets the upper and lower grid frequency thresholds. If grid frequency goes outside this range, the inverter will disconnect to protect the system and comply with grid safety standards.

points.title: Grid Frequency Limits (Stage 3)
points.help: Sets the upper and lower grid frequency thresholds. If grid frequency goes outside this range, the inverter will disconnect to protect the system and comply with grid safety standards.

points.title: Grid Voltage Trip Time
points.help: Defines how long the grid voltage must remain below the lower limit or above the upper limit (Stage 1) before the inverter disconnects.

points.title: Grid Voltage Trip Time (Stage 2)
points.help: Defines how long the grid voltage must remain below the lower limit or above the upper limit (Stage 2) before the inverter disconnects.

points.title: Grid Voltage Trip Time (Stage 3)
points.help: Defines how long the grid voltage must remain below the lower limit or above the upper limit (Stage 3) before the inverter disconnects.

points.title: Grid Frequency Trip Time (Stage 1)
points.help: Defines how long the grid frequency must remain below the lower limit or above the upper limit (Stage 1) before the inverter disconnects.

points.title: Grid Frequency Trip Time (Stage 2)
points.help: Defines how long the grid frequency must remain below the lower limit or above the upper limit (Stage 2) before the inverter disconnects.

points.title: Grid Frequency Trip Time (Stage 3)
points.help: Defines how long the grid frequency must remain below the lower limit or above the upper limit (Stage 3) before the inverter disconnects.

points.title: Permit Service Status
points.help: Attribute in GridConnection cluster

points.help: Attribute in VoltageReactivePowerMode cluster

points.help: Attribute in VoltageReactivePowerMode cluster

points.title: PQ Mode Status
points.help: Attribute in ActivePowerReactivePowerMode cluster

points.title: P_QP
points.help: Attribute in ActivePowerReactivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Voltage Active Power Mode
points.help: Attribute in VoltageActivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Volt Watt V
points.help: Attribute in VoltageActivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Volt Watt P2
points.help: Attribute in VoltageActivePowerMode cluster

points.help: Attribute in VoltageActivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Frequency Active Power Mode Status
points.help: Attribute in FrequencyActivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Open Loop Response Time
points.help: Attribute in FrequencyActivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Over Frequency Droop_db OF
points.help: Attribute in FrequencyActivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Over Frequency Droop_k OF
points.help: Attribute in FrequencyActivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Under Frequency Droop_db UF
points.help: Attribute in FrequencyActivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Under Frequency Droop_k UF
points.help: Attribute in FrequencyActivePowerMode cluster

points.title: Off-Grid Output
points.help: Controls whether the inverter provides AC output when operating without the utility grid. Disable to prevent output in off-grid mode.

points.title: Backup (EPS) Output Voltage
points.help: Selects the AC output voltage when operating in backup (EPS) mode. Match this to your local service voltage for proper compatibility with connected loads.

points.title: Generator Port Connection
points.help: If using a generator, select which port it's connected to — either the GEN port or the Grid Input port (sometimes called microgrid mode). If no generator is installed, leave this setting on GEN port.

friendly_meanings.0: GEN port (also select if not using generator).

points.title: Battery Charge Current Limit
points.help: Sets the maximum DC current the inverter will send to the battery from the generator.

points.title: Generator Rated Power
points.help: Specify the generator's continuous rated output power.

points.title: Generator Cool-Down Time
points.help: Sets the time the generator continues running after charging stops to allow for safe cooling.

points.title: Generator Start/Stop SOC
points.help: Configures the battery state of charge thresholds for automatic generator control. The generator will start when battery SOC drops to StartSOC and stop when it reaches StopSOC.

entries.name: Start SOC (%)
entries.description: Generator starts when battery drops to this level

entries.name: Stop SOC (%)
entries.description: Generator stops when battery charges to this level

points.title: Generator Contactor Status
points.help: Indicates the current state of the generator control contactor.

points.title: Generator Test
points.help: Start the generator for a test run.

points.title: Generator Boost
points.help: Enables dynamic adjustment of generator charging power for faster battery recovery when needed.

points.title: AC-Coupled PV
points.help: Enable this option when connecting a grid-tied solar inverter (AC-coupled PV) to the system. Disable when no AC-coupled PV is present.

points.title: AC-Coupled PV SOC Limits
points.help: Defines the battery state-of-charge thresholds that control when the inverter allows AC-coupled PV charging to start and stop.

entries.name: Start SOC (%)
entries.description: AC-coupled PV begins charging when SOC drops to this level (typical 20-40%)

entries.name: Stop SOC (%)
entries.description: AC-coupled PV stops charging when SOC reaches this level (typical 80-95%)

points.title: Use Smart Load
points.help: Powers non-essential loads only when excess solar or battery energy is available. Enable this to automatically use surplus energy for optional circuits.

points.title: Smart Load On-Grid Behavior
points.help: Determines Smart Load behavior while the system is connected to the grid. When enabled, the Smart Load remains powered even if normal control conditions are not met. (AKA: **On Grid Always On**.)

points.title: Smart Load Start Power
points.help: Defines when the Smart Load turns on. The Smart Load port is energized once PV power exceeds this threshold **and** the battery SOC is above the start limit.

points.title: Smart Load SOC Limits
points.help: Defines the battery state-of-charge limits that control the Smart Load. The Smart Load turns on when SOC rises above the start limit **and** PV power exceeds the start power limit.  Smart load turns off when SOC falls below the stop limit.

entries.name: Start When Battery SOC Is Above (%)
Stop When Battery SOC Is Below (%)
